short_summary: Consulting services for the reconstruction of the Fishermen's Wharf at Cap-aux-Meules
description: PWGSC, on behalf of TRANSPORT CANADA, is issuing this REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL to find a consulting firm or consulting joint venture to providethe professional services required for the Reconstruction of the Cap-aux-Meules Fishermen's Wharf on the îles-de-la-Madeleine project.
full_summary:
# Government Tender Announcement

### Request for Proposal: Reconstruction of the Fishermen's Wharf at Cap-aux-Meules

**Public Service and Procurement Canada (PSPC)**,[smart-city-home]

**Title:** Architectural and Engineering Services for the Reconstruction of the Fishermen's Wharf at Cap-aux-Meules

**Tender Reference:** WS4298343665

**Amendment Number:** 7

**Solicitation Number:** WS4298343665

**Publication Date:** November 8, 2023

**Tender Closing Date:** January 19, 2024, at 14:00 EST

### Project Overview

The Department of Transport and Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC) invites consulting firms or joint ventures to submit a proposal for the Reconstruction of the Fishermen's Wharf at Cap-aux-Meules on Îles-de-la-Madeleine, Quebec. This Request for Proposal (RFP) solicits bids for professional services related to architectural and engineering services.

### Project Description

The project involves the reconstruction of the Fishermen's Wharf at Cap-aux-Meules, which is essential for the local fishing industry. The successful bidder will provide professional services, including architectural and engineering expertise, to ensure the successful completion of the project.

### Terms of Reference

The bidder must meet the requirements outlined in the RFP document, which includes the selection criteria and procurement method. The project is subject to trade agreements and procurement methods as outlined in the RFP.

### Submission Guidelines

Bidders are required to submit their proposals in accordance with the instructions outlined in the RFP document. The deadline for submission is 14:00 EST on January 19, 2024.

### Contact Information

For more information or clarification on the RFP, please contact Jennifer Kirouac, SPAC/PSPC, at jennifer.kirouac@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca or visit the Ariba website.

### Notice URL

https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/17954763?extsite=MTc5NTQ3NjNfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==

The original text was quite long, so I focused on keeping the essential details of the RFP (Request for Proposal) and rearranged the content
